title: Why are philosophers considered the most intelligent? - Quora

response.answer_text: Not sure it is so. But I think, in the case, is for the ability of abstraction. Also philosophers works with words and concepts so they are good in the art of speaking and explaining, and the bad ones use they rethorical skills to fool people. But at least the same level of abstraction is pursued by mathematicians with numbers and by scientist by images. But math and science are harder (or impossible) to explain to non specialistic audience.

Because they have risked their dignity and respect by making their views known, often in a systematic way and typically in the public record — and for having expended the effort to think deeply outside the box and inside themselves (areas the common person usually lacks the ability, time or inclination to explore).
